Bitcoin Exchange Reviews

Use this Bitcoin exchange list to find the best Bitcoin exchange for you. Each user has unique needs, so there is no "best" or "top" bitcoin exchange. This page, however, will help you find the best exchange for you based on your specific needs.

Our Bitcoin exchange reviews detail each exchange's supported countries, payment methods accepted, fees, privacy, limits, liquidity, reputation, speed (delivery of bitcoin), customer support, and any past issues.

Global Bitcoin Exchanges

These Bitcoins exchanges work anywhere in the world where there are available buyers or sellers.

LocalBitcoins Visit Full Review

LocalBitcoins is a P2P Bitcoin exchange and escrow service. Buyers and sellers agree on trade terms, and LocalBitcoins makes sure the trade goes through with no problems for both parties. LocalBitcoins is considered a good way to buy bitcoins privately or with cash.

Visit LocalBitcoins Full Review

VirWoX Visit Full Review

VirWox offers one of the few ways to buy bitcoin with PayPal: buy buying Second Life Lindens with PayPal, and then trading the Second Life Lindens for bitcoin.

Visit VirWoX Full Review

Popular Bitcoin Exchanges

Coinbase Visit Full Review

Coinbase is the world's largest Bitcoin broker, available in the United States, Canada, Singapore, and most of Europe. Customers can buy bitcoin with a connected bank account, SEPA transfer, Interac Online, iDEAL, and many more payment methods depending on location.

Visit Coinbase Full Review

U.S. Bitcoin Exchanges

The exchanges mentioned above are available in the United States. This section covers exchanges that are available only to U.S. residents.

Circle Visit Full Review

Circle is a Bitcoin broker offering its services in the United States. Customers can buy bitcoin with a bank account, credit card, or debit card. Circle has plants to expand its services to other countries.

Visit Circle Full Review

Bitcoin Exchanges in France

Coinhouse Visit Full Review

Coinhouse, based in Paris, France, lets users buy bitcoin with a 3D secure credit card or debit card, or with Neosurf prepaid cards. Coinhouse has plans to expand its service to the rest of Europe in early-2016.

Visit Coinhouse Full Review
